programme.title: Steam Days
programme.desc: Miles Kington travels along one of the most picturesque railways in Britain, from Fort William to Mallaig on the west coast of Scotland, a route used by crofters for the herring trade. First transmitted in 1986

programme.title: The Train Now Departing
programme.desc: Examining the events surrounding the proposed closure of the Settle to Carlisle line - over 72 miles long and Englands highest mainline, it was known as The Long Drag by the men who worked it. The programme follows the activists, comprised of railway-men, rail enthusiasts and local residents, who are rallying together to save the line. First broadcast 15 November 1988

programme.title: Brief Encounter
programme.desc: A suburban housewife meets a married doctor by chance in a railway station waiting room. Later, their paths cross many times until the pair become friends and their meetings a fixed arrangement. But as their feelings for each other transform from friendship into passion, both come to realise the affair is doomed to fail. David Leans romantic drama, starring Celia Johnson and Trevor Howard

programme.title: Sarah Churchwell Remembers - The Great Gatsby
programme.desc: Leading academic Sarah Churchwell looks at the origins of F Scott Fitzgeralds The Great Gatsby, and the inspiration behind its plot and characters. She also explores how the novel became an enduring work of art, which has been adapted and performed countless times since it was first published in 1925

programme.title: The Great Gatsby
programme.desc: A poor soldier leaves the love of his life to make his fortune overseas, but on his return is devastated to learn she has married a cruel, uncaring man. Throwing caution to the wind, he uses his newly acquired wealth and position in society to romance her - leading to tragedy for all concerned. Drama based on F Scott Fitzgeralds classic novel, starring Mira Sorvino, Toby Stephens, Paul Rudd and Martin Donovan

programme.title: The Great Gatsby
programme.desc: A profile of American writer F Scott Fitzgerald from the 75th anniversary of the publication of his most enduring achievement, The Great Gatsby, originally published in 1925. Also, exploring the novels importance within the 20th-century. First broadcast 3 April 2000

programme.title: Tár
programme.desc: Lydia Tár, principal conductor of the Berlin Philharmonic, is poised to begin rehearsals of Mahlers Symphony No 5 with the players. When disturbing accusations surface about the maestro and a troubled graduate of her academy, every aspect of Társ life comes under intense scrutiny. Writer-director Todd Fields drama, starring Cate Blanchett, Noemie Merlant and Nina Hoss

programme.title: Steam Days

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Jo Whiley presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 12 June 1998 Featuring Mousse T feat Hot n Juicy, Lutricia McNeal, Shania Twain, Alexia, Del Amitri, Mariah Carey, England United and B*witched

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Jayne Middlemiss presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 19 June 1998. Featuring Five, Pulp, Desree, Silver Sun, Ian Brown, Dario G, Fat Les and Baddiel, Skinner and The Lightning Seeds

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Peter Powell and Stevie Wright present the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 18 September 1986. Featuring Eurythmics, Michael McDonald, Orchestral Manoeuvres in the Dark, Cameo, the Communards and Five Star

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Mark Franklin introduces the edition first shown on September 16 1993. Featuring performances by Motorhead, Pet Shop Boys, Radiohead, Jade, Lenny Kravitz, Chaka Demus and Pliers, Belinda Carlisle and Culture Beat

programme.title: Jimi Hendrix: Electric Church
programme.desc: Documentary follows Jimi Hendrixs seminal performance at the 1970 Atlanta Pop Festival, where he played in front of 300,000 people. Featuring interviews with Hendrix and fellow musicians, including Paul McCartney and Mitch Mitchell

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive footage of guitarists taken from BBC music shows of the 1970s. Includes electric performances by Carlos Santana, Mark Knopfler, Peter Green and the Edge, and acoustic material by John Martyn, John Renbourn, Bert Jansch and Paco Pena

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: A celebration of 1970s-era axe-men, acoustic virtuosos and thumping riff merchants, in a compilation of guitar-heavy performances from the BBC TV archives. Guitar gods including Jimi Hendrix, Pete Townshend, Peter Green and Johnny Winter are joined by, among others, flamenco maestro Manitas De Plata, bottleneck bluesman Ry Cooder and straight-up rockers AC/DC and Thin Lizzy. Plus, Fleetwood Mac, the Jam and Be Bop Deluxe and Nils Lofgren

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.sub-title: Even More Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Status Quo play Pictures of Matchstick Men on Top of the Pops in 1968, the Who perform Long Live Rock in the Old Grey Whistle Test studio, Dire Straits deliver Tunnel of Love and Lynyrd Skynyrd bring a taste of the American South with Sweet Home Alabama. The programme also features rare performances from George Benson, Leo Kottke, Link Wray and Tom Petty

programme.desc: Gethin Jones and Kimberley Walsh host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: How a few tiny specks of grey paint help to solve not one, but two, brutal axe murders. Plus, how a bungling burglar was caught when his DNA is discovered on a rock used to smash a window. Narrated by Chuku Modu

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts wants to run for the hills due to a tricky legal issue in Devon. Jacqui Joseph is in Eastbourne, East Sussex, where work is already under way at an end-of-terrace. Meanwhile, Dion Dublin heads to Northampton, where a smelly cellar is hard to cope with

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Siblings Anna and Will compete against amateur pilots Ben and Chris Roo Irvine, hunting for bargains at an antiques fair in in Co Antrim alongside expert advisors Caroline Hawley and Thomas Forrester. Host Roo Irvine dives into maritime history with a mightily heavy mystery item, made of solid brass with copper rivets

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Jeanette Kwakye presents further coverage of day six of the biennial event, held this year at Japan National Stadium in Tokyo, featuring the mens and womens 400m finals at 2.10 and 2.24 respectively. With analysis from Jessica Ennis-Hill and Jenny Meadows, and commentary by Steve Cram, Steve Backley, Andrew Cotter, Colin Jackson, Paula Radcliffe and Stef Reid

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson is in Derbyshire with a recently married couple who are making an epic location shift and swapping the Blue Mountains in Australia for the wilds of the Peak District. They have a significant budget of £750,000 and have their hearts set on a character home with a large garden for their three dogs. Away from his quest, Jules comes across an unlikely centre of manufacturing nestled in the countys rural countryside

programme.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
programme.desc: Robin Johnson and James Broad help an Edinburgh widow sell her collectibles, turning up a rare watch that could make a small fortune at auction, a collection of railwayana, a 19th-century spinning wheel and a scratched magnifying glass

programme.title: The Answer Run
programme.desc: Jason Manford hosts the fast-paced quiz show in which three couples face a series of 50/50 questions that hurtle down the Answer Run towards them

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which five pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Stephen Mangan

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest, presented by Roman Kemp and Alex Jones

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Jack is set on revealing the truth about Zoes shooting, so Denise turns to Ravi for help. Julie attempts to talk to Joel about his misogynistic beliefs - but it may not be enough

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Heston Blumenthals three Michelin-starred establishment The Fat Duck has inspired generations by ripping up the culinary rulebook. His dishes excite all senses, giving the diner an experience like no other. The semi-finalists mark the restaurants 30th anniversary by recreating some of his most celebrated dishes. They are next tasked to cook a dish filled with theatre and magic - something ambitious that is full of wonder. Emotion and storytelling are crucial components, as Heston will be hoping for some passion in the plates he tastes. Only five cooks will go through to the next round

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island
programme.desc: The events of castaway day cause a tidal wave across Honeymoon Island. A crate washes up to give the honeymooners some much-needed support from home, before one husband is left with a shocking decision to make. Presented by Davina McCall

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: The View
programme.desc: Mark Carruthers reviews the weeks political news, including reports on the latest events at Stormont and Westminster. Plus, comment and analysis with studio guests

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in London to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: A panel of BBC journalists hosts a weekly round-up from Westminster, delivering the usual mix of serious analysis and light-hearted gossip about the biggest stories in politics

programme.desc: Kym Marsh and Rav Wilding host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: Fingerprints found at the scene of a burglary are the missing piece of evidence detectives need to convict a man responsible for the murder of the flat owner. When a man is found beaten to death in his own property, police use footprints found around his body to identify one assailant, before putting together their case against his violent accomplice whom they suspect of the killing. Plus, a pair of crooks who burgled an old man and went on a spending spree with his card are caught by CCTV

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: The team catches up on one of the shows most unusual and lengthy projects, to undercover a warren of underground Second World War tunnels near Dover. There are also developments in St Johns Wood, one of north Londons most affluent suburbs, as well as a double opportunity at a house in Stoke-on-Trent

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: At Southwell Racecourse in Nottinghamshire, married couple Emma and Zack take on partners Beth and Charlie, assisted by experts Phil Serrell and Roo Irvine respectively. Natasha Raskin Sharp keeps an eye on the proceedings and liaises with auctioneer Richard Winterton about the wisdom of their purchases

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.desc: Local news worth watching from across Northern Ireland

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: The part-time sleuth is surprised by a visit from her mother, who is worried about her husbands obsession with a belief that catastrophic events relating to the Cold War are being planned at the British open chess championships. Sister Boniface decides to brush up on her chess skills and enter the tournament. Lorna Watson stars

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Ginny Buckley helps a couple with have a substantial budget of £700,000, who are hoping to relocate their family to the Norfolk countryside. For over half a century, Norfolk has also been home to Lotus cars, so while in the county Ginny finds out more about the company heritage before catching a glimpse of the future when the companys latest hypercar is unveiled

programme.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
programme.desc: Dawns life changed drastically when her husband died. The family home in the West Midlands town of Sutton Coldfield, once filled with joy, had begun to overwhelm her with memories. Wanting to downsize and move closer to her daughter, she calls upon the support of presenters Robin Johnson and Izzie Balmer. The duo soon discover transforming tables, pharmaceutical paraphernalia and secret symbols in a house full of collections. Narrated by Christina Trevanion

programme.title: The Answer Run
programme.desc: Jason Manford hosts the fast-paced quiz show in which three couples face a series of 50/50 questions that hurtle down the Answer Run towards them

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which five pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Stephen Mangan

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Clara Amfo and Alex Jones present the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances

programme.title: Paula McIntyres Hamely Kitchen
programme.desc: Paula heads to Kentucky to meet a food writer with Scots-Irish roots, who shows her how to make the perfect buttermilk-fried chicken. She also meets a chef at a farm-to-table restaurant who is putting mountain ingredients such as squash and buttermilk cheese on his menu. Her last stop is to a dairy farm that makes an usual but very tasty buttermilk ice-cream. Paula continues the buttermilk theme in her outdoor mountain kitchen when she makes a buttermilk, lima bean and bacon soup and skillet-cooked biscuits with watermelon, strawberry and coconut jam and whipped buttermilk cream

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Guest panellists Jo Brand, Sam Quek, Bobby Seagull and Joe Thomas join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The semi-finals conclude with five contenders left in the competition. Making the leap to the final stages is no mean feat as the next brief pushes the amateurs to their culinary limit, cooking a dish that celebrates an ingredient they cannot stand. Their chosen ingredients include offal, bananas and liquorice and they need to pull something extraordinary out of the bag as only four will progress. One unfortunate competitor will be kicking themselves as they miss what will surely be the opportunity of a lifetime

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island
programme.desc: The recent flare-up causes suspicion and speculation among the remaining honeymooners - and even some of the strongest couples start to feel the strain of stranded life. At the Couples Cove Masquerade Ball, the arrival of an unexpected guest sends shockwaves through the group. Presented by Davina McCall

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: Knocked Up
programme.desc: Ambitious journalist Alisons one-night stand with directionless layabout Ben has unexpected consequences when she discovers she is pregnant. However, the unlikely parents-to-be decide to give the relationship a try for their babys sake, forcing Ben to face the challenge of accepting responsibility for the first time in his life. Romantic comedy, starring Seth Rogen, Katherine Heigl and Paul Rudd

programme.title: The Hit List
programme.desc: Marvin and Rochelle Humes host a famous family special of the music quiz. Actor Kola Bokinni and his sister DJ Yinka Bokinni, Outnumbered siblings Tyger Drew-Honey and Ramona Marquez, and Stacey Dooley and her partner, actor and dancer Kevin Clifton, compete to name as many songs and artists as possible, with the best pair playing for up to £10,000 in the final round

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Athletics: World Championships Highlights
programme.desc: Sarah Mulkerrins presents action from day six of the biennial event, held this year at Japan National Stadium in Tokyo. Team GB stars Matthew Hudson-Smith and Amber Anning were both hoping for a podium place in the respective mens and womens 400m finals

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Roman Emperor Caesar Augustus reveals the lazy secret of his success, TVs most excitable reporter Bob Hale explains the very complex history of the Second World War, and Welsh hero Owain Glyndwr takes on the English in battle

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson puts the Renaultsport Twingo 133 through a stringent examination in Belfast - with a helping hand from actor Ross Kemp. Richard Hammond samples the delights of racing airport vehicles and James May takes the Vauxhall Insignia VXR for a drive in the company of Margaret Calvert, whose ideas were central to the design of modern British road signs. Film director Guy Ritchie is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car, and there is also a group test of high-performance off-roaders from BMW, Audi and Range Rover

programme.title: Juice
programme.desc: Comedy, written by and starring Mawaan Rizwan, following one mans quest for attention from anyone wholl give it to him. After splitting up with Guy, Jamma is now between jobs and sleeping on Winnies sofa. However, when he unexpectedly sees Guy for the first time in six months at Isaacs pop-up art exhibition, the spark between the exes is undeniable. To Jamma and Guys surprise a handsome stranger takes a special interest in their relationship status. With Russell Tovey

programme.title: Juice
programme.desc: Guys double-booked himself, so asks Jamma to house-sit and let a builder in. Jamma finds Guys manuscript about exes, but on discovering hes not included is sent into a spiral. Isaac comes over to calm Jamma down, but the pair discover Saif pampering himself in the house. Farida arrives with divorce papers and a new showbiz career to show off about. Sitcom, written by and starring Mawaan Rizwan and Russell Tovey

programme.title: Our Girl
programme.desc: As the unit prepares to withdraw from Afghanistan, the captain and Smurf both declare their feelings for Molly, creating a love triangle that compromises Army regulations. However, reality bites after another raid against the Taliban and soon the platoon is sent on one final, terrifying mission. Military drama, starring Lacey Turner, Ben Aldridge and Iwan Rheon

programme.title: Our Girl
programme.desc: Molly returns from Afghanistan, and with difficult questions raining down upon her, its clear that the things shes seen and heard there have had a life-changing impact. The devastating attack on Captain James and Smurf has left this soldier picking up the threads of her life and weaving them into some kind of future - but what will that entail? Ben Aldridge and Iwan Rheon also star in the military drama

programme.title: We Built a Zoo
programme.desc: Documentary following 19-year-old TikTok star Kyle Thomas as he attempts to build a zoo for exotic species and separate himself from past controversy with animal rights activists. He enlists the help of farmer and builder Phil Hughes and together the pair plan on turning Phils modest petting farm into a world-class sanctuary for unwanted exotic animals

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson puts the Renaultsport Twingo 133 through a stringent examination in Belfast - with a helping hand from actor Ross Kemp. Richard Hammond samples the delights of racing airport vehicles and James May takes the Vauxhall Insignia VXR for a drive in the company of Margaret Calvert, whose ideas were central to the design of modern British road signs. Film director Guy Ritchie is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car, and there is also a group test of high-performance off-roaders from BMW, Audi and Range Rover

programme.title: Juice
programme.desc: Comedy, written by and starring Mawaan Rizwan, following one mans quest for attention from anyone wholl give it to him. After splitting up with Guy, Jamma is now between jobs and sleeping on Winnies sofa. However, when he unexpectedly sees Guy for the first time in six months at Isaacs pop-up art exhibition, the spark between the exes is undeniable. To Jamma and Guys surprise a handsome stranger takes a special interest in their relationship status. With Russell Tovey

programme.title: Juice
programme.desc: Guys double-booked himself, so asks Jamma to house-sit and let a builder in. Jamma finds Guys manuscript about exes, but on discovering hes not included is sent into a spiral. Isaac comes over to calm Jamma down, but the pair discover Saif pampering himself in the house. Farida arrives with divorce papers and a new showbiz career to show off about. Sitcom, written by and starring Mawaan Rizwan and Russell Tovey

programme.title: Angels of the North
programme.sub-title: I Cannae Cos the Child Locks On
programme.desc: Sammyjo enlists the Longlox girls help as she makes plans for her and Garys first anniversary, while Carmen wants to pierce below the waist. After Nathans third weigh-in, the Bilton Boys head off for a nights camping

programme.title: Angels of the North
programme.sub-title: I Looked Like Phil Mitchell Til I Was About Three
programme.desc: Shane starts preparing for life as an uncle as Jades baby bump grows and Carmen gets disappointing news about her piercing plans. The Bilton Boys save the day for Robbies mum and Sammyjos plans for a new tattoo take a surprising turn

programme.title: The Fast and the Farmer-ish
programme.desc: Teams compete to be the best tractor drivers in England. In this heat, the Leicestershire Diva Drivers are determined to outmanoeuvre Somersets Checkshirt Choppers and win a place in the semi-final. Farmer and YouTuber Tom Pemberton hosts as the teams go head-to-head in three high-octane agricultural challenges

programme.title: The Fast and the Farmer-ish
programme.desc: In the Welsh heat, two teams of young farmers from south-west Wales put their reputations as skilled drivers on the line. Its the West Wales Cowboys versus the Chipmunks, and both teams are determined to fly the flag for their nation in the semi-finals

programme.title: Athletics: World Championships Highlights
programme.desc: Sarah Mulkerrins presents action from day seven of the biennial event, held this year at Japan National Stadium in Tokyo. Great Britains Katarina Johnson-Thompson started the defence of her heptathlon title with the sprint hurdles, high jump, shot put and 200 metres, and her compatriots Keely Hodgkinson and Georgina Bell were expected to line-up in the womens 800m semi-finals

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: A Celtic farmer is not keen on plans for Hadrians Wall, the identity of Britains top-scoring footballer is revealed, and pioneers of transport sing about their inventions

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May bid to prove that cars can be art by filling a gallery in Middlesbrough with motoring-related works, including a few creations of their own. They also resort to unusual promotional techniques to attract more visitors to their exhibition. Back on the track, Jeremy tests British supercar the Noble M600. Jenson Button drives the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: A Frog Of A Problem/Fool The Forest/Mushroomates/Race The Beast/Surprise, Its Spring/The Missing Mushlet
programme.desc: Mush-Mush’s favourite frog has had its home taken over by a lizard. Mushpot says not to interfere – nature will balance itself out. / It’s Fool the Forest Day! Mushables pull pranks all over Mushton, and Mush-Mush has an epic one planned. / When ants invade Fung and Miff’s tree, our Mushlers offer for them to move in… but the two quickly turn out to be unbearable roommates. / Mush-Mush and his friends are determined to win the bark sledge race, but their essential fourth team member drops out. / Puff doesn’t like change much. And with spring about to burst forth and all the changes spring brings, he is puffing out nervous fog which is blanketing the whole of Mushton. / So Mushpie can take a break, Mush-Mush, Chep and Lilit offer to look after the Mushies, assuring her that everything will be fine.

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.sub-title: Mirror, Mirror On The Wall/Grizzy The...
programme.desc: ...Wizard/Moonwalk Bear/Camping in the Wild/Ice and Bears/Carried Away Bear/Fountain of Bear Youth/Lemmings Kit/Timeless Bear => While salmon fishing on the riverbank Grizzy hauls in an unusual catch: an old hand mirror straight out of a fairytale. / In a casing that fell from a circus caravan the Lemmings find a magic stick that can enchant objects and make them come alive. / Grizzy stops the Lemmings from playing with fireworks. / With their endless battles over the rangers cabin which they do not want to share Grizzy and the Lemmings end up blowing the cabin up. / The Lemmings encounter a white bear which has drifted all the way to them on a chunk of ice which is slowly melting. / Grizzy gets rid of the Lemmings by crushing them. / The Lemmings discover a strange pond in an American Indian grotto that has the power to rejuvenate anyone who dips in it. / Before taking a nap Grizzy locks the food in a cupboard to prevent the Lemmings from getting into it. / When Grizzy and the Lemmings accidentally activate a magic disk representing the earth they are sent back in time to the prehistoric era.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: The Snake Dance/Grasshopper Chep/The Adventurers/Getting Truffy With It/Good Vibrations
programme.desc: When Mush-Mush and Chep lose Lilit’s flying disc down a snake tunnel, he is confident he can get it back. / All the Mushables have fun zooming down a long mudslide except Chep, who just cant get up the courage to do it. / Because Mush-Mush, Chep and Lilit are always up to new adventures, Bolly has dubbed them The Adventurers. / Truff is happy. He has found a necklace that makes him even Truffier! Except he had no idea the necklace belongs to Starmush. / Lilit is under pressure. Truff, the most talented musician in Mushton, has invited her, Mush-Mush and Chep to form a band with him.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: Work Like a Charm/The Breathtaking Bolly Show/Whos Eating Mushton/Mush-Mush The Predictor
programme.desc: Chep becomes obsessed with learning all about Mushlore – all the funny little traditions and things that Mushables believe in. / If Mush-Mush had Bolly’s speed, he’d want everyone to see just how awesomely fast he was. / Everyone in Mushton is finding that their precious wooden things are being munched and destroyed by someone or something. / Mush-Mush can’t figure out why his sense foot keeps buzzing like crazy… until an earthquake shakes the forest. Mush-Mush is sure he predicted it!

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Tim Shaw and Fuzz Townshend travel to Devon to fix up one of the fastest road cars of its time, a 1997 Mitsubishi Evo 4. The car that Tim and Fuzz are taking on belongs to 60-year-old Gary, a petrolhead who loved his Evo and used it as his daily driver

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village

For the showstopper, they serve up sweet bread in tiers. Sadly, for one baker, this will be their last day in the tent. Who will be dusting themselves off and hanging up their apron?

programme.desc: Two players are cut from the will, and the Deceased sets a request that pushes the remaining players further than ever as they fulfil the final orders of her wellness brand. programme.title: The Inheritance
programme.desc: The latest request sends the players on a bear hunt. The Division Ceremony brings more revelations, which lead to an explosive row that threatens to tear the players apart

programme.title: The Inheritance

programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer look back on two period properties that desperately needed to be adapted for modern-day living. They meet the Sarah and Ian Renard in Brixworth, Northamptonshire. With one toddler and two dogs to house, this two-bed rural semi is bursting at the seams and Ian wants out. Theres only one thing stopping him: Sarah, who is determined to stay and convinced that the house still has the potential to cater for a growing family. programme.desc: A look at how retailers, private security and the police are fighting back against the rise of shoplifting in the UK. There is also the case of a store that has turned to cutting-edge predictive AI technology after thieves stole more than a million pounds worth of goods

programme.title: Fare Dodgers: At War with the Law

At Southampton, Spencer is on high alert after claims that two young women who push through the barriers are being abusive and are trying to travel for free. At Waterloo Harry takes on tailgaters and the abuse of half-price child tickets at half term. And two newly trained recruits are on the Weymouth to London line - a route notorious for fare dodgers

programme.desc: The youngster finds himself in a fierce competition with Paige when their mothers force them to attend Vacation Bible School. George is furious after Georgie makes a questionable purchase. Imagine Armpit stars

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: A Musty Crypt and a Stick to Pee On
programme.desc: Dale and Meemaw work out their relationship issues while playing Dungeons and Dragons with Sheldon and Missy. Mary and George take a trip with Coach Wilkins and his wife, and Georgie is alarmed to learn his girlfriend thinks shes pregnant. Iain Armitage stars

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard tries to use his wedding as an excuse to avoid being sent into space, but ends up accepting the mission. Amy plots to get Sheldon to take the next step in their relationship, while Leonard accidentally asks Penny to marry him

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: As Howard and his fellow astronauts sit in the space shuttle awaiting launch, he reflects on the tumultuous events of the previous few days, when he and Bernadette tried to get married. Meanwhile, his friends witness the blast-off on TV at home

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire struggles to get hold of the years must-have gadget for Phils birthday. Cam gets involved in a neighbours marital problems, while Mitchell decides it is time to toughen up. Comedy, starring Julie Bowen, Ty Burrell, Eric Stonestreet and Jesse Tyler Ferguson

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Luke and Mannys hot-tempered basketball coach quits, causing Jay and Phil to compete for the position. Elsewhere, Mitchell introduces Cameron to a prospective employer. Comedy, starring Nolan Gould, Rico Rodriguez, Ed ONeill and Ty Burrell

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: An argument between Leonard and Sheldon over the ending of a Harry Potter book affects Amy and Pennys living arrangements. Meanwhile, Howard goes on a trip to Las Vegas with Bernadette and asks Raj to keep an eye on his mother while he is away

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Penny celebrate Valentines Day, but their evening takes a turn for the worse when the latters ex-boyfriend proposes to his girlfriend in the same restaurant. Meanwhile, Sheldon enlists the help of his assistant Alex to find the perfect gift for Amy

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj is upset after Lucy runs away in the middle of their date, leaving the gang to cheer him up. However, when Howard bumps into her, she admits she is incredibly shy. Meanwhile, Sheldon asks Penny to help with a new episode of Fun with Flags, and because he is impressed by her acting ability, the friends go to see her in a performance of A Streetcar Named Desire

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: While the girls go to Disneyland and get made up as princesses, the guys have to promote science as a career option for women at Howards old middle school. Meanwhile, Raj and Lucy have their first date in a library, where instead of speaking to each other they send text messages

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Part one of two. A prison van crash sees a mass escape of convicts take place and the entire squad has to track the villains down. Peralta and Santiago make a bet on which of them can bring in the most escaped prisoners, with the loser forced to move into the winners apartment when they start living together. Former American football star Marshawn Lynch guests

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Part two of two. Only one fugitive remains on the loose on the streets of Brooklyn after the mass escape of convicts from the prison van and Peralta is forced to enlist a surprising ally in order to apprehend him. Elsewhere, Santiago and Gina attempt to introduce Boyle to proper texting etiquette. Craig Robinson guest stars

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Ned Flanders buys the Simpsons home when they are unable to pay their mortgage and rents it back to them at an affordable rate, but Homer soon takes advantage of his new landlords generosity

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa has to go undercover as a nun and infiltrate a convent when Maggie goes missing after being left on its doorstep. Meanwhile, Marge is left temporarily blind when she stares at a total eclipse, so Homer has to sort out their rat-infested kitchen

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon leaves for Texas when his sister goes into labour. While he is away, the rest of the friends decorate for Christmas and reflect on how much he has changed their lives. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny makes an important decision after Leonard tries to help her in the aftermath of a failed role on a TV show. Meanwhile, Raj and Stuart practise talking to strangers at a shopping centre, and Sheldon studies to become a comic genius. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon tries to relax after he is forced to take a holiday, and when Penny quits her job the duo end up spending time together. Meanwhile, Leonard struggles to be supportive of his girlfriends career decision, Bernadette seeks Stuarts help in replacing one of Howards comic books, and Howard and Raj provide Amy with some advice. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: When the guys are unable to get tickets for Comic-Con, Leonard, Howard and Raj decide to buy fake passes from a stranger - but they then worry about getting caught with them. Sheldon decides to hold his own comic-book convention and searches for a suitable star guest for the event. Meanwhile, the girls take tea at a hotel but discover that maturity is over-rated. Comedy, guest starring James Earl Jones and Carrie Fisher

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer follows the Rev Lovejoys advice and becomes a missionary on a remote Pacific island, where he soon corrupts the innocent natives by press-ganging them into building a casino. With the guest voice of Betty White

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Moe decides to change his down-at-heel image by undergoing plastic surgery - and transforms himself so radically that he ends up getting a job as an actor in a soap opera. Unfortunately, he makes the mistake of sneaking Homer onto the set for a guest appearance, and ends up getting fired

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer is distressed to learn that Lenny and Carl fixed the result of a senior class presidential election, which he lost in high school - leading him to speculate on how his life would have changed for the better had he won the ballot

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge starts her own sandwich shop after her snacks become a huge hit at Springfield Elementary. However, running a business proves challenging - especially when the same franchise opens another location across the street

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Cake-maker and self-confessed princess Fiona seeks someone chunky and funky, finding herself paired with recruitment consultant Rakim. Ex-soldier Tristan from Exeter is on a mission to find his perfect woman after being single for four years. Will beach-loving Ema get swept away by his passion for the south west? Twenty-nine-year-old Lewis - whose narcolepsy caused him to fall asleep on a previous date - is paired with DJ Thom, while lager and football-lover Jessica is introduced to fellow northerner and pub-lover Ryan

programme.title: Moonfall
programme.desc: A mysterious force knocks the Moon from its orbit and sends the Earths only natural satellite on a collision course with our planet. Astronauts Jocinda Fowler and Brian Harper, who served together on an ill-fated space mission, join forces with conspiracy theorist KC Houseman to avert catastrophe. Director Roland Emmerichs sci-fi thriller, starring Patrick Wilson, Halle Berry, John Bradley and Donald Sutherland in one of his final films

programme.title: GI Joe: The Rise of Cobra
programme.desc: When a powerful experimental weapon is snatched by a mysterious terrorist organisation, two of the soldiers guarding it are recruited into a top-secret military strike force. As they go in search of the stolen technology, they uncover a plot by its creator to take over the world. Action adventure, with Channing Tatum, Sienna Miller and Christopher Eccleston

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart sets out to save Homer from the embarrassing effects of his latest misfortune, and does so well he becomes convinced he possesses miraculous healing powers. Featuring the guest voice of Don Cheadle (Iron Man 2)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on programmes from April 2020, including Tiger King: Murder, Mayhem and Madness, the Queens address about the coronavirus, Keeping up with the Kardashians and news coverage of Prime Minister Boris Johnsons hospitalisation

programme.title: Below Deck
programme.desc: Catty and hard-to-please guests challenge the crew. Captain Kerry voices his concerns as he learns about Jared and Cats personal struggles. Barbie vows to be a better stew, Xandi gets frustrated by Cats inexperience, while Jared continues to give Barbie the ick - leading her closer to Kyle. Fraser chooses his second stew, as Jareds personal demons send him on a downward spiral

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: When a baby is kidnapped by a mystery man, CID turn their attentions to the babys mother, who appears to have something to hide

programme.title: The Mouse That Roared
programme.desc: The leaders of the tiny European duchy of Grand Fenwick decide to solve their bankruptcy problem by declaring war on the USA. They confidently expect to lose and thereby qualify for economic aid - but the plan takes an unexpected turn for the worse when the Americans surrender. Comedy, starring Peter Sellers in three roles, with Jean Seberg, William Hartnell, David Kossoff and Leo McKern

programme.title: Dead of Night
programme.desc: A group of people gather at a country house where their supernatural stories become all too real for one of the guests, who realises theyre all part of his recurring nightmare. Horror anthology, starring Mervyn Johns, Michael Redgrave and Googie Withers

programme.title: Hue and Cry
programme.desc: A schoolboy in post-war London stumbles on a criminal conspiracy whose members use his favourite comic strip to secretly send information to each other about their illegal activities. The police do not take him seriously, so he enlists his friends to help stop the crooks. Ealing comedy, starring Alastair Sim, Harry Fowler, Jack Warner and Valerie White

programme.title: The Fallen Idol
programme.desc: An ambassadors son idolises his fathers butler, and tries to throw the police off his scent when he is suspected of murder. However, the boys actions only make the servant seem more suspicious, and he begins to realise that his hero may have deceived him. Crime drama, starring Ralph Richardson and Bobby Henrey

programme.title: Film4 Interview Specials
programme.desc: Stars Tom Cruise, Rebecca Ferguson, Henry Cavill, Simon Pegg, Vanessa Kirby and director Christopher McQuarrie talk about making the sixth instalment in the franchise

programme.title: Hunter Killer
programme.desc: Unconventional submarine skipper Joe Glass is sent to investigate the torpedoing of US and Russian vessels. He winds up trying to rescue the Russian president, who has been kidnapped by a rogue general. Action thriller, starring Gerard Butler, Gary Oldman and Common

programme.title: Film4 Interview Specials
programme.desc: Stars Tom Cruise, Rebecca Ferguson, Henry Cavill, Simon Pegg, Vanessa Kirby and director Christopher McQuarrie talk about making the sixth instalment in the franchise

programme.title: The Contractor
programme.desc: After being involuntarily discharged from the Marines, a man joins a paramilitary organisation to support his family in the only way he knows how. Drama, starring Chris Pine, Ben Foster, Gillian Jacobs and Kiefer Sutherland

programme.title: A Time to Kill
programme.desc: A lawyer in Mississippi agrees to defend a black man charged with killing the two racist thugs who raped his 10-year-old daughter - but he is ill-prepared for the racial tension and violence that erupts during the course of the trial. Courtroom drama, based on a novel by John Grisham and starring Matthew McConaughey, Sandra Bullock, Samuel L Jackson, Donald Sutherland and Kevin Spacey

programme.title: Dreamland
programme.desc: During the Great Depression, Eugene Evans dreams of escaping his small Texas town when he discovers a wounded, fugitive bank robber. Torn between claiming the bounty for her capture and his growing attraction to the seductive criminal, Eugene must make a decision that will affect the lives of everyone hes ever loved. Romantic drama, starring Finn Cole and Margot Robbie

programme.title: Mandy
programme.desc: A couple whose daughter was born deaf and mute decide to enrol her in a special class in the hope that she might learn to speak. The difficulties they face in raising their child expose the tensions within their marriage. Drama based on the novel The Day Is Ours by Hilda Lewis, starring Phyllis Calvert, Jack Hawkins, Mandy Miller and Terence Morgan

programme.title: Arizona Raiders
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the American Civil War, two Confederate soldiers are offered a way out of jail. Their former comrades-in-arms are now a gang of bandits terrorising Arizona, and the two prisoners are sent to infiltrate the group and bring them to justice. Western, starring Audie Murphy, Buster Crabbe, Ben Cooper and Gloria Talbott

programme.title: All the Kings Men
programme.desc: A small-town senator wins popular support by railing against the corruption of the political establishment and vowing to defend the interests of ordinary working people. However, once in office, he succumbs to greed as readily as those he once so virulently condemned. Political drama, starring Broderick Crawford, Joanne Dru, John Ireland and Mercedes McCambridge

programme.title: The Black Swan
programme.desc: Notorious pirate Henry Morgan is made governor of Jamaica, and offers other buccaneers the choice of giving up their lawless ways or facing justice. Two rogues refuse to toe the line, so Morgans trusted ally James Waring is sent to track them down, but has other things on his mind - namely winning the daughter of the previous governor away from her duplicitous fiance. High-seas adventure, with Tyrone Power, Laird Cregar, George Sanders, Maureen OHara and Anthony Quinn

programme.title: The Eagle
programme.desc: A Roman centurion seeks to restore his fathers honour by recovering the standard of a legion that disappeared. Accompanied by his British slave, he makes a dangerous journey north of Hadrians Wall into the Scottish Highlands, territory occupied by hostile tribes. Action adventure, starring Channing Tatum, Jamie Bell, Mark Strong and Donald Sutherland

programme.title: Legion
programme.desc: The Archangel Michael turns his back on Heaven and travels to a small-town diner to protect a pregnant waitress and her unborn child from Gods wrath. Action fantasy, starring Paul Bettany, Dennis Quaid, Lucas Black, Tyrese Gibson, Adrianne Palicki and Willa Holland

programme.title: Morbius
programme.desc: Dangerously ill with a rare blood disorder, and determined to save others suffering his same fate, biochemist Dr Michael Morbius attempts a desperate gamble. However, what at first appears to be a radical success soon reveals itself to be a remedy potentially worse than the disease, when he develops a form of vampirism. Comic-book adventure, starring Jared Leto, Matt Smith, Adria Arjona and Jared Harris

programme.title: The Hate U Give
programme.desc: Starr Carter lives in two worlds - the poor, black neighbourhood where she resides and the mostly white prep school she attends. When she witnesses the fatal shooting of her childhood friend by a policeman, Starr must find her voice and stand up for whats right. Drama, starring Amandla Stenberg, Regina Hall and Russell Hornsby

programme.title: Demetrius and the Gladiators
programme.desc: A Greek slave is forced into the gladiatorial service when he defends an elderly merchant from the attack of a sadistic centurion. But he also has the hallowed robe of Christ - which makes him the target of Emperor Caligula and the treacherous Messalina, because they believe it has special powers. However, the reluctant gladiator does not intend to give it up to them. Historical drama, starring Victor Mature, Susan Hayward, Michael Rennie and Debra Paget

programme.title: Tombstone Territory
programme.desc: With an increase in the murders of miners, Hollister has to find those responsible with a stolen black diamond holding a clue

programme.title: Tombstone Territory

programme.title: Rage at Dawn
programme.desc: Three notorious outlaw brothers terrorise Indiana, using a small town as a safe haven and paying off local officials to turn a blind eye. A detective poses as a fellow bandit to set a trap for them, but the case is complicated when he falls for their sister, who remains misguidedly loyal to her villainous family. Western, starring Randolph Scott, Forrest Tucker, Mala Powers and J Carrol Naish

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is approached by the wife of a wanted man eager to turn himself in peacefully, provided Josh splits the bounty with his wife. To ensure the deal goes as planned, Josh enlists the aid of his old friend Sheriff Pat Garrett

programme.title: The Persuaders!

programme.title: The New Avengers
programme.desc: Gambit is due to meet an agent called Travis, but on his arrival he discovers he has been killed, and in possession of a suspicious film. Espionage adventure, starring Patrick Macnee and Gareth Hunt

programme.title: Centurion
programme.desc: A Roman legion is sent on a mission to crush a Pictish uprising, only to be nearly wiped out in a savage ambush. A centurion who survives the massacre takes charge of the survivors and leads them on a daring mission to rescue their captured general and make it back to their own territory alive. Neil Marshalls action thriller, with Michael Fassbender, Dominic West and Olga Kurylenko

programme.desc: Marlon comes clean to Donna about his role in the robbery. Laurel gets amorous in a desperate bid to induce her baby, while Billy accuses Diane of trying to split him and Val up.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Ken moves in with Denise and announces he wont be in touch with Deirdre unless she apologises. Michelle tells Steve a secret about Paul after hearing about their high-stakes round of golf

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Steve and Michelle are caught kissing - but Liz isnt too happy about the blossoming relationship - while Blanche plays match-maker when Ken comes to collect more things.

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Pauline finds out about Martins imminent departure to London and confronts him over her uncertain future. Aunt Joan tries to solve her farms money problems by opening a BandB - and ends up having to call the doctor for her first guest, local farmer Ted. Elsewhere, Bert organises a baby shower for Louisa. David Ross (The Green Green Grass) guest stars, with Martin Clunes, Stephanie Cole and Caroline Catz

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The doctor spends his last day in Portwenn seeing an influx of patients as he prepares to close down the surgery and move to London. As he bids farewell to old friends and sets off to leave the village, he sees Louisas teaching assistant Tasha fall from the Harbour Day stage and stops to help. But the bigger hold-up comes when pregnant Louisa is involved in a car accident. Martin Clunes and Caroline Catz star

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Dr Weatherill is involved in an air rescue to save an unconscious girl and finds herself braving a cliff abseil to reach the youngster. Dr Ormerod faces a difficult time when he misdiagnoses a patient who is left fighting for life in hospital. Sister Brigid has an accident on her bike, while Harper faces a staff revolt. Medical drama, starring Amy Robbins, Robert Daws, Linda Armstrong and John Axon

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Greengrass meets his match in a gang of loutish Liverpudlians, and the Aidensfield bobbies investigate a case worthy of Agatha Christie, involving an old woman found dead in a mysterious house. Meanwhile, behind the scenes, Craddock makes a shock announcement to Ventress. Bill Maynard, William Simons and Philip Franks star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Ventress tries to discover why an old foe has returned to Aidensfield, and Greengrass makes a touching promise to a dying friend - but has a fight on his hands keeping it. Meanwhile, Maggie is concerned about a girl who wants an abortion. Rural drama, starring Jason Durr, Kazia Pelka and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Donna is stunned by Marlons revelation. She lashes out at Eli and tells him to get out of her life, before telling Marlon their marriage is over.

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Emily inadvertently locks Laurel in the church, where she goes into labour with only Shadrach on hand to help. Diane argues with Jack before kissing Billy in the Woolpack.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Fiz is mortified by Johns reaction to their kiss, only to get an even bigger surprise when Kirk catches up with her. Steve has his hopes of a romantic evening dashed.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Michelle looks forward to another date with Steve, only to discover hes brought Amy along. Kirk is distraught after being dumped, while Claire takes decisive action against the Mortons.

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The curmudgeonly GP struggles to come to terms with his new role as a father, having planned to resume his career as a consultant in London before the arrival of his and Louisas as-yet unnamed son. To make matters worse, he begins to have serious doubts about the competency of his replacement Dr Di Dibbs when she misdiagnoses a patient as well as herself. Martin is then dealt a devastating personal blow after hearing his aunt Joan has died. Starring Martin Clunes, Joanna Scanlan and Caroline Catz

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The GP returns to his former post at the surgery after the departure of Dr Dibbs, agreeing to stay until a replacement is found. He persuades a reluctant Louisa to move into his house so he can help raise their son, and suggests they could all move to London together in the future. Martin then delivers the eulogy at his aunt Joans funeral and speaks to her sister Ruth, who proves to be just as cantankerous as he is. Comedy drama, starring Martin Clunes and Caroline Catz, with Eileen Atkins

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Mike attracts the unwanted attentions of a famous romantic novelist who has moved to the area in search of literary inspiration, while borstal boys on a work placement cause mayhem in the village. Greengrass helps a would-be councillors election campaign - and has no qualms about playing dirty to foil rival candidate Blaketons bid for office. Starring Jason Durr and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Mike plans to marry Jackie in secret, but the search for an armed train robber threatens to keep him from getting to the church on time. Meanwhile, Greengrass faces another kind of crisis _ his charismatic sister Isabelle turns up in Aidensfield, and proves to be more than a match for him. Judy Cornwell guest stars

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective is drawn into Newcastles underworld to discover the identity of a murder victim found dead in the river, with no clue as to who he is apart from a distinctive drugs wrapper. She discovers the dead man had ties to some very dangerous people, many of whom may have wanted him dead, while a witnesss testimony links the case to a remote farm where a murder took place 13 years previously. The connection brings Kennys past back to haunt him, as he was responsible for seeing the perpetrator convicted

programme.title: Law and Order: UK
programme.desc: When the body of an elderly woman is discovered at a well-known suicide spot, Ronnie soon detects foul play, with suspicion falling on the victims son and daughter-in-law, as well as a doctor who has recently arrived in the UK. However, even after a confession is secured, Joe remains baffled as to the motive, and Kate struggles to remain professional - jeopardising her career and leaving Jake to prosecute the case alone. Guest starring Haydn Gwynne

programme.title: Law and Order: UK
programme.desc: A blood-spattered hotel room and a stolen credit card lead Ronnie and Joe to Charles Hutton, a member of the wealthy upper classes who dotes on his wife Camille and daughter Georgia. The detectives find clues that suggest Georgia gave birth at the scene, but where is the baby now? The young woman and her boyfriend Rufus prove difficult for Jake and Kate to prosecute, and to make matters worse, the defence counsel turns out to be Jakes old nemesis. As the evidence stacks up, how far will Charles go to protect his privileged family? Guest starring James Wilby and Joseph Millson

programme.title: Agatha Christies Poirot
programme.desc: English country squire Marcus Waverly receives a series of anonymous letters threatening to kidnap his son Johnnie, but the case is dismissed by Scotland Yard - prompting Poirot to open his own investigation. Drama, starring David Suchet and Geoffrey Bateman

programme.title: Playing Nice
programme.desc: The final court hearing looms and the fate of the boys is set to be decided. Will Miless twisted lies be exposed for what they are, or will Pete and Maddie lose everything? Psychological thriller adapted from the best-selling novel by JP Delaney, starring James Norton, Niamh Algar, James McArdle and Jessica Brown Findlay

Medical drama starring John Axon, Amy Robbins, Anna Madeley and Barbara Marten

programme.desc: Mike attracts the unwanted attentions of a famous romantic novelist who has moved to the area in search of literary inspiration, while borstal boys on a work placement cause mayhem in the village. programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Diane packs her bags after Billy tells her to choose between him and Jack. New mum Laurel is upset to learn her parents wont be visiting, while Donna moves back into Tall Trees.

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Billy risks returning to prison by stealing a car to follow Diane, while Lexi gets an invitation to a jewellery sale at Home Farm. Jimmy notices tension between Kelly and Carrie.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Fire attacks the Peacock home and Claire is knocked unconscious as she rushes to save Freddie. Leannes cover may be blown when Dev asks her to find him a Spanish villa.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Deirdre visits Ken to tell him how much he still means to her - but he wants to make a new start with Daniel. Liam tries to get to the bottom of Leanne and Pauls mutual dislike.

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: New receptionist Morwenna Newcross (Jessica Ransom) gets off to a bad start after arriving late on her first day, and her hyperactive behaviour leads Martin to believe she is high on drugs. Ruth tries to deal with an intruder on the farm who has stolen the hub caps from her car, and the sleepless nights begin to take their toll on Martin and Louisa, who are running out of ways to comfort their constantly wailing baby. Guest starring Andrew-Lee Potts (Primeval)

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Louisas hippie mother Eleanor (Louise Jameson) arrives in the village, immediately taking over Martins kitchen to prepare a herbal tonic, which she later gives to the baby to stop his crying. A culinary rivalry develops between Bert and Mark Bridge, the landlord of the Crab and Lobster pub, at Portwenn Fun Day, with both keen to take advantage of the event by providing food for the spectators

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Blaketons attempts to crack down on crime meet with a violent response and Ginas interest is aroused by a mysterious visitor. Greengrass has his eye on the main chance as usual - he reckons there is big money to be made by attracting tourists to Aidensfield and decides to rewrite local history to make the village more interesting. Derek Fowlds, Tricia Penrose and Bill Maynard star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Mike makes a shocking discovery about Jackie, forcing him to re-evaluate his marriage almost before it has begun, while unlikely undertaker Greengrass applies his ingenuity to the task of arranging a funeral with a difference. Rural drama, starring Jason Durr, Fiona Dolman and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Joyce Barnaby swerves off the road into a ditch, convinced she has hit someone, but nobody is found injured and Tom thinks she has imagined it. However, when a local historian discovers the body of a librarian in a nearby cemetery, Joyce blames herself for the mans death, leading her husband into a spooky investigation to find the real killer on the loose in the haunted village of March Magna. Guest starring Danny Webb (The Bill), with John Nettles, Jason Hughes and Jane Wymark

programme.title: Law and Order: UK
programme.desc: When a series of shootings claims one of their own, Ronnie and Joe have little time to grieve - they must solve the case before the killer reaches their next target on a hit list that includes CPS director Henry Sharpe. It gradually becomes apparent that the common thread connecting all the names is the case of Mark Glendon, convicted of the murder of his wife four years earlier. Although hes still in custody, a retrial is imminent, putting pressure on the team to catch the murderer before the jury delivers its verdict

programme.title: Law and Order: UK
programme.desc: Still reeling from the death of one of their own, Ronnie and Joe face a new challenge when an innocent young mum is fatally stabbed in a busy marketplace, just as a senior police officer publicly pledges to crack down on knife crime. Under pressure from all sides, the pair struggle to gather evidence against the youth they think is responsible, and the suspects unintentional confession appears to bring the case to a close. However, Ronnie is the only person who hears the admission, and it proves difficult getting anyone to believe him. With the detectives honesty cast into doubt and his effectiveness questioned at every turn, is this the end of his career? With Tony Gardner, Sharon Small and Colin Salmon

programme.title: Agatha Christies Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian detective begins to suspect something is amiss when he visits one of his favoured haunts in London for dinner and discovers a fellow regular has dramatically changed his diet. Down in Brighton, elderly Anthony Gascoigne lies dying while his estranged twin brother Henry falls to his death - but nobody is sure whether the man was deliberately pushed. Bizarrely, the key to the riddle seems to lie in a blackberry pie. David Suchet stars in the title role, with Philip Jackson, Hugh Fraser and Pauline Moran

programme.title: Joanna Lumleys Home Sweet Home - Travels in My Own Land
programme.desc: After a lifetime of travels that have taken her across the globe, Joanna Lumley is making her most personal journey yet. The final episode takes Joanna from North Wales to St Michaels Mount and the West Country, ending in her home city of London

programme.title: Chateau DIY

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: Alison and Zion bicker while dismantling and rebuilding an old polytunnel, while Tim and Sasha create a luxurious bridal suite by connecting two rooms via a built-in wardrobe

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to Newton House in Knaresborough, North Yorkshire, where Denise Carter and Jackie Fennells traditional BandB focuses on organic, free-range breakfasts. Over dinner, guest Marianne Cammack and Deina Thomas from dominate the conversation, riling up some of the others, while Mike Hayes and Neal Widdowson think the morning meal is all way too fancy

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the competition is to the Highlands Pub in Blackpool, where managers Mike Hayes and Neal Widdowson are all about value for money. However, Sean and Kathryn are horrified by what they find in their room, while Marianne and Deina think that theirs needs the female touch. In the afternoon the group competes in a basketball challenge at the amusement arcades, where the quiet hosts come out of their shells

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to the White House in Brighton for the third day of the competition, where hosts Sean Edlin and Kathryn Turnbull run a laid-back seaside BandB. Denise and Jackie think the rooms are not well equipped and Marianne finds them clinical, while Mike and Neal are unsure about the price. Tensions are temporarily alleviated by a visit to the famous Theatre Royal, but Marianne and Deina continue to cause trouble at dinner. In the morning, a locally sourced breakfast impresses some of the guests, but the group must decide whether they are getting value for money

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Wakes Hall Lodges near Colchester is the fourth and final visit of the week, where Neal and Mike are wowed by the five-star self-catering accommodation, complete with hot tubs and lakeside views. The others arent so sure about the luxury breakfast hamper, however, especially as it means cooking their own. An afternoon of dog agility gives manager Marianne Cammack the chance to demonstrate her authority, although over dinner, her domineering conversation causes Jackie to finally snap

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The BandB owners meet for the last time to find out what theyve been paid and to settle some scores. Mike and Neal from the Highlands Pub challenge the comments that they were considered dirty and lacking in facilities, while Sean and Kathryn from the White House are left smarting after suffering large underpayments for what they think are minor issues. Eventually, the winner is finally revealed

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Fuzz Townshend and Tim Shaw help Darren, who was left disabled after a tragic road accident in which he saved his grandson, by fixing up his iconic 1989 Golf

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Fuzz Townshend and Tim Shaw take on one of the most divisive British sports cars ever made - a Triumph TR7. Can the team help make owner Barrys dream come true?

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer take two couples house-hunting in south Wales. Chris and Laura want a slice of the countryside with dreams of a vegetable patch in a huge garden for their one-year-old son Jack to play in but when the perfect place arises reality brings them down from cloud nine. Bob and Lara want a three-to-four bed family home in the city and parking is a must but Phil struggles to tick all the boxes in the competitive Cardiff housing market where theyve already been outbid 10 times

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: In Surrey, Kirstie and Phil are searching for homes to bring their house-hunters closer to family. Kirstie meets Lauren, who has decided to move out of her London flat to her own place in Guildford after a serious health scare. She is looking for space to work from home but the high prices in the area leave Kirstie struggling to find a property within budget that ticks all the boxes. Phil meets Eleanor, Laurence and their four-month old twin boys who are moving from Birmingham to be closer to their parents in Surbiton, but with house prices where they are searching being nearly double where they have left, Phil has his work cut out for him

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Tom and Danielle Raffield, whose lifelong passion has been steam-bending wood. Theyve used the technique to create extraordinary furniture and lighting, but now plan to use it on a larger scale. In an attempt to escape the confines of their tiny gamekeepers lodge, they have decided to build a wavy wooden house in South Cornwall, completed with curved cladding, twisted furniture and interior walls covered with weathered timber. With a £100,000 budget, the pair have decided to do a lot of the building themselves, and Kevin is on hand to discover whether theyre up to the challenge

programme.title: Night Coppers
programme.desc: Leanne and Emily arrive at the scene of a car crash and race to catch a suspected dangerous driver who attempts to flee on foot. Ollie and Harry are called to investigate an altercation between housemates. In the centre of town, Petes coppers nose leads him to uncover something entirely unexpected

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: Medics at Kings College Hospital treat 79-year-old Arthur, who has been brought into resus with acute stomach discomfort and has several underlying conditions that could be to blame. Meanwhile, 20-year-old wine merchant Tom is rushed into AandE after collapsing with sharp chest pains and breathing difficulties, and retired soldier Rockey is concerned about his blurred vision

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: This edition sees staff at Kings College Hospital in south London treat patients involved in serious road accidents. Former soldier Steve, 48, was found unconscious at the wheel, 11-year-old schoolgirl Scarlett has been knocked down by a car, and Pauline, 70, was hit by a vehicle that mounted the pavement, seriously injuring her lower legs

programme.title: The Good Doctor
programme.desc: Part one of two. The team travels to Guatemala to help patients at a rural hospital, but while Shaun seems to be thriving on the mission, Lea is still struggling with her loss

programme.title: Night Coppers

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE

Meanwhile, 20-year-old wine merchant Tom is rushed into AandE after collapsing with sharp chest pains and breathing difficulties, and retired soldier Rockey is concerned about his blurred vision

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt investigates concerns about levels of naturally occurring arsenic in baby rice products, Jimmy Doherty examines Marks and Spencers claim that they can trace all their beefburgers back to the cow, and Kate Quilton find out whether a parasite could be hiding in sushi. Programme exploring the secrets behind mass-produced food, meeting technicians, scientists, factory owners, growers and producers to find out exactly what goes into the groceries that end up on the supermarket shelves

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: Theres chaos at a BandB in France when a pipe bursts during check in. A restaurateur in Portugal runs out of cutlery, a family of brewers from Kent launch their beer at a prestigious market, while at a BandB in Italy, the guests cannot find the bidet

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: As the summer draws to a close in France, brewers from Kent create a new beer for a medieval chateau, and a couple from London serve afternoon tea. At a BandB in Italy, the hosts cook a fabulous dinner for guests

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: Its an exciting day for Amy and Marc, as they get an award for their renovations and host a picnic in their garden for 60 of the organisations members. However, the garden is criss-crossed by open trenches for all their ongoing plumbing and electrical work. Becky and Mark are under pressure to complete their final guest room, but they still find time to introduce their daughters to two new kittens. In north west France, Philip and Angelina are flat out preparing for the events season. The moat must be navigated to smarten up the chateaus enormous shutters and Angelina makes over a kilometre of bunting. Narrated by Adjoa Andoh

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: At Château de Lalande, Stephanie and Gerry go all out in the final stages of their Marquis Salon restoration. Their efforts may annoy carpenter Amaury, but its an expensive shopping trip that leaves Gerry gasping. Near Bordeaux, at Château Lagorce, Anna and Edward have their work cut out restoring their wedding catering kitchen following devastating storm floods. And at Château de Brives, George and Sarah try to capitalise on their extensive experience in the antiques trade by trialling a new weekend event

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The latest competition begins at No 33 Hunstanton in Norfolk, where owner Janie Thompson and housekeeper Gemma Layfield hope their quirky design and high-end brand of luxury will win the day. Despite the decor, the in-room bath receives a soggy reception from Cheryle and Anthony Katz, owners of The Lansdowne in the Cotswolds. An afternoon of painting sees Mark and Jan Rummery from The Ivybridge in Goodwick, Wales, emerge as the ones to beat and the groups banter begins. At dinner, father-and-son duo Mick and Chris Emanuele from La Tavola Calda in Nuneaton reveal that theyre BandB old-timers and their Italian roots pique interest

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to La Tavola Calda in Nuneaton, where father-and-son team Mick and Chris Emanuele run a basic BandB above their Italian restaurant. On arrival, Mark and Jan are horrified by the standard of decor. That evening, Mick and Chris reveal their George Michael tribute act will be performing after dinner. Janie and Gemma love the experience, but the noise in the rooms keeps Jan awake

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to the Lansdowne in the Cotswolds, where hosts Cheryle and Anthony Katz hope their hospitality expertise will charm their way to the top. Although the rooms are a hit for Janie and Gemma, Mick and Chris are determined to find fault. Mark and Jan reveal a competitive streak during an afternoon of husky racing, and come dinner Anthony and Cheryle have their business credentials scrutinised

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit is to the Ivybridge Hotel and Spa in Fishguard Bay, Pembrokeshire, where Mark and Jan Rummery have brought their hospitality experience in Asia to Wales. On arrival, Cheryle and Anthony are unimpressed to be housed in an annexe, and Mick and Chris dismiss the bathroom as a bodge job. During an afternoon of Chinese cookery, the tensions are palpable as relationships continue to disintegrate

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The BandB owners meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and to thrash out their issues. No 33 Hunstanton is up first, as hosts Janie and Gemma quiz Mark and Jan over their privacy problems. Next, father and son duo Mick and Chris Emanuele from La Tavola Calda want to put Cheryle and Anthonys sleep issues to bed. Eventually, matters are resolved and the winner is announced

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Tim Shaw and Fuzz Townshend delve into unknown territory when they transform Charlies beloved Lexus IS200 into a full-blown competition drift car

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Tim Shaw and Fuzz Townshend restore Adams Datsun 240k Skyline, an extremely rare Japanese classic from the 1970s. In fact, with only two others on the road, its the rarest car theyve ever taken on

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer scour the south coast between Southampton and Bognor Regis, where both the tide and the pressure to find properties are running high. Kirsties couple, Antoinette and Matt, have been renting in Southampton for three years, paying more than £30,000 in the process. They want their money to go into a home they own instead, but their search has been stalled by unsuccessful offers. Theyre looking for a four-bedroom house with a garden and a living room big enough for two televisions so the pair can enjoy their separate hobbies together. One particular property really hits the mark, but with other interested parties Kirstie must draw on her years of experience to ensure Antoinette and Matt arent pipped at the post yet again. Meanwhile, Phil is searching in and around charming Chichester with Catherine, who wants a fresh start following the end of her marriage. Three-bedrooms and a short commute to work are priorities, but that narrows the pool of potential properties. Phil tries a couple of curve balls, but ultimately location wins out over size and Catherine finds a house she thinks is the one

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: The dynamic property duo catch up with two sets of house-hunters who wanted to make the switch from London life to family life. In 2016, Cara and Ben realised that in order to have the space they wanted theyd need to move out of the capital. Keen cyclist Ben discovered Bishops Stortford when he was out on a bike ride, and the couple moved into a rental property there so that they could get a feel for the town before they bought. With the surprise arrival of baby Max, and their rental lease about to end, they were desperate to buy a place of their own. Phil showed them just what they were looking for, and as fate would have it, just around the corner from their rental. Kirstie and Phil catch up with Cara and Ben to find that theyve expanded to a family of four and the house has had a serious makeover. In 2020, Tom and his Floridian wife Kaitlyn were still house sharing with Toms old schoolfriend in south London. Desperate to find their own pad to start a family in and even with a healthy budget of £450k, the couple had been struggling to find everything on their wish list: three bedrooms, character, lots of outside space for keen gardener Tom, and the American-style large open-plan living space that Kaitlyn was used to. Even with Kirstie and Phil onside, none of the properties they saw hit enough of their marks to make the couple want to offer, so Phil advised them to expand their search area further east into Kent. Now, Phils back to see how theyre getting on

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of 37-year-old Angelo Mastropietro, as he transforms a damp, dark and abandoned cave in Worcestershire. Having recently been diagnosed with multiple sclerosis, Angelo wants to create a retreat to help him cope with the news and become a 21st-century caveman. He has a budget of £100,000 and plans to almost single-handedly carve, cut and drill into the hillside to make the cave comfortable for contemporary living. However, there is no manual for a project of this kind, and the unique challenge soon becomes an obsession

programme.title: Inspector Gerri
programme.sub-title: A Promise Is a Debt - Part One
programme.desc: A young woman is found murdered in her home. Initial suspicions focus on her partner, who had been abusing her for some time and is on the run. The couples children are placed in a childrens residential facility, while the police discover that others had motives for wanting to get rid of her. And in his personal quest, Gerri is trying to find Tano, an older boy who was kind to him when he was a child. In Italian

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: Young parents Nicole and Stefian arrive in resus with their 19-month-old daughter XahNae, who is unresponsive and has a high fever, and doctors fear she may have a life-threatening infection. Meanwhile, the team suspects 61-year-old Christine has suffered a second stroke in 10 years, and 52-year-old Graham, who has Downs syndrome, is brought into AandE by his sisters following an accident

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: Bill, 92, arrives at Kings with breathing difficulties and a swollen leg and test results suggest there may be something seriously wrong, while 25-year-old Sarah is finding it hard to stand up and has been brought in by her mum and grandfather.
